Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	WAEC / OND /Trade Test
	1 to 3 years of experience in similar roles in a hotel or restaurant or a company.
	Ready to work and attend interviews at location.
	We prefer candidates living in Omole Phase 1 and environs.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;ayomaku@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Receptionist Job at DMOT Enterprises




        
    

        
        DMOT Enterprises - Our client, a new Hotel, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Omole Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	WAEC / OND /Trade Test
	1 to 3 years of experience in similar roles in a hotel or restaurant or a company.
	Ready to work and attend interviews at location.
	We prefer candidates living in Omole Phase 1 and environs.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ayomaku@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Greenwich Trustees Limited, a member of the Greenwich Trust Group; one of Nigeria&rsquo;s leading independent Investment Banking firm, commenced operations in year 2000 as Afribank Trustees &amp; Asset Management Company LTD, a subsidiary of the then Afribank Nigeria PLC. We offer high-level professional services that combine Financial and Investment advice, Trusteeship, Retirement and Estate Planning all of which are offered through boutique products that have been tailored to meet our clients&rsquo; need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trust&nbsp;Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Role


	The officer oversees and coordinates the business activities of the company in Lagos


Requirements


	First Degree in Law from a reputable Nigerian University with&nbsp;3-5 years as aTrust Offcer in a Trustee Company
	Must have been involved in drafting of commercial transaction and documents with clear understanding duties of Trustees.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@greenwichtrustees.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Trust Manager Job at Greenwich Trustees Limited




        
    

        
        Greenwich Trustees Limited, a member of the Greenwich Trust Group; one of Nigeria’s leading independent Investment Banking firm, commenced operations in year 2000 as Afribank Trustees & Asset Management Company LTD, a subsidiary of the then Afribank Nigeria PLC. We offer high-level professional services that combine Financial and Investment advice, Trusteeship, Retirement and Estate Planning all of which are offered through boutique products that have been tailored to meet our clients’ need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Trust Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Role
     

            
    




	The officer oversees and coordinates the business activities of the company in Lagos


Requirements


	First Degree in Law from a reputable Nigerian University with 3-5 years as aTrust Offcer in a Trustee Company
	Must have been involved in drafting of commercial transaction and documents with clear understanding duties of Trustees.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@greenwichtrustees.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Manager",
  "description": "International Golden Edge Trading (IGET) Limited is an e-commerce startup in Nigeria with operations in different locations in Nigeria

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lakowe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking a high-energy, detail-oriented Warehouse Manager to lead our daily fulfillment operations. As the leader of our warehouse, you will be responsible for ensuring every order is picked, packed, and shipped with 100% accuracy.
	You will manage a team of associates, optimize our warehouse layout for maximum speed, and ensure that our inventory records match the physical reality on our shelves.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead, mentor, and schedule a team of fulfillment officers to meet daily productivity and fulfillment goals.
	Oversee the entire workflow of receiving, storage, picking, packing, and dispatching goods to ensure timely customer delivery.
	Execute regular cycle counts and audits to maintain high inventory accuracy and resolve discrepancies immediately.
	Enforce strict health and safety standards (e.g., OSHA) and ensure all equipment, such as forklifts, is maintained and operated safely.
	Monitor and report on core warehouse KPIs, including Order Picking Accuracy, Dock-to-Stock time, and Labor Productivity.
	Implement 5S methodology (Sort, Set in order, Shine, Standardize, Sustain) to optimize space utilization and reduce order cycle times.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3&ndash;5 years in warehouse or logistics management, ideally within a high-volume e-commerce or FMCG environment.
	Proficiency in using Warehouse Management Systems and inventory software.
	Must be able to lift up to 25kg and stand/walk for extended periods.
	Forklift operator certification is often required; OSHA safety training is a major plus.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and the ability to communicate effectively with carriers, vendors, and top management.
	Experience in automated sorting or picking systems
	Background in lean warehousing and process optimization


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;gloria@igoldenedge.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-05",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "International Golden Edge Trading Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

Warehouse Manager Job at International Golden Edge Trading Limited




        
    

        
        International Golden Edge Trading (IGET) Limited is an e-commerce startup in Nigeria with operations in different locations in Nigeria

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Lakowe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a high-energy, detail-oriented Warehouse Manager to lead our daily fulfillment operations. As the leader of our warehouse, you will be responsible for ensuring every order is picked, packed, and shipped with 100% accuracy.
	You will manage a team of associates, optimize our warehouse layout for maximum speed, and ensure that our inventory records match the physical reality on our shelves.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead, mentor, and schedule a team of fulfillment officers to meet daily productivity and fulfillment goals.
	Oversee the entire workflow of receiving, storage, picking, packing, and dispatching goods to ensure timely customer delivery.
	Execute regular cycle counts and audits to maintain high inventory accuracy and resolve discrepancies immediately.
	Enforce strict health and safety standards (e.g., OSHA) and ensure all equipment, such as forklifts, is maintained and operated safely.
	Monitor and report on core warehouse KPIs, including Order Picking Accuracy, Dock-to-Stock time, and Labor Productivity.
	Implement 5S methodology (Sort, Set in order, Shine, Standardize, Sustain) to optimize space utilization and reduce order cycle times.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3–5 years in warehouse or logistics management, ideally within a high-volume e-commerce or FMCG environment.
	Proficiency in using Warehouse Management Systems and inventory software.
	Must be able to lift up to 25kg and stand/walk for extended periods.
	Forklift operator certification is often required; OSHA safety training is a major plus.
	Strong problem-solving abilities and the ability to communicate effectively with carriers, vendors, and top management.
	Experience in automated sorting or picking systems
	Background in lean warehousing and process optimization


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: gloria@igoldenedge.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content & Social Media Manager",
  "description": "Ujax Engineering is an indigenous Engineering company in the business of Smart-building automation Services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content &amp; Social Media Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a Content &amp; Social Media Manager who understands how to tell real project stories online.
	This role is about creating simple, engaging content that shows what we do: smart buildings, ELV systems, solar, CCTV, and automation&mdash;without overcomplicating things. You&rsquo;ll manage our social media pages, create content from site activities, and help grow our online presence.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and create content for Instagram, LinkedIn, and other platforms
	Turn site work, installations, and projects into clear and engaging posts
	Write captions using everyday words that people can relate to
	Manage posting schedules and ensure consistency
	Work with the technical team to understand projects and explain them simply
	Create basic graphics and short videos (before, during, after installs)
	Respond to comments and messages professionally
	Track content performance and suggest improvements
	Maintain Ujax&rsquo;s brand voice across all platforms


Requirements


	Proven experience managing social media or digital content
	Good writing skills and ability to explain technical work in simple terms
	Basic knowledge of content tools (Canva, CapCut, etc.)
	Ability to edit short videos and photos from site work
	Creative thinking and attention to detail
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Interest in engineering, technology, or smart systems is a big plus.


What We Offer


	Salary Range N100,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Hands-on experience working with real engineering projects
	Creative freedom to tell real project stories
	Supportive team environment


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV to:&nbsp;jobs@ujax.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.:&nbsp;",

Content & Social Media Manager Job at Ujax Engineering




        
    

        
        Ujax Engineering is an indigenous Engineering company in the business of Smart-building automation Services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content & Social Media Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Content & Social Media Manager who understands how to tell real project stories online.
	This role is about creating simple, engaging content that shows what we do: smart buildings, ELV systems, solar, CCTV, and automation—without overcomplicating things. You’ll manage our social media pages, create content from site activities, and help grow our online presence.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan and create content for Instagram, LinkedIn, and other platforms
	Turn site work, installations, and projects into clear and engaging posts
	Write captions using everyday words that people can relate to
	Manage posting schedules and ensure consistency
	Work with the technical team to understand projects and explain them simply
	Create basic graphics and short videos (before, during, after installs)
	Respond to comments and messages professionally
	Track content performance and suggest improvements
	Maintain Ujax’s brand voice across all platforms


Requirements


	Proven experience managing social media or digital content
	Good writing skills and ability to explain technical work in simple terms
	Basic knowledge of content tools (Canva, CapCut, etc.)
	Ability to edit short videos and photos from site work
	Creative thinking and attention to detail
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Interest in engineering, technology, or smart systems is a big plus.


What We Offer


	Salary Range N100,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Hands-on experience working with real engineering projects
	Creative freedom to tell real project stories
	Supportive team environment


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@ujax.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.:     

    

        Click here to Apply
